title: User guide
text: Biosimulation models often include numerical parameters determine outputs model. Often, values parameters known advance identified matching possible model outputs observed data. Finding parameter values best match observed data called parameter estimation. ospsuite.parameteridentification package provides class setting tasks based existing PKML models, mapping model outputs observed data estimating parameters. , model example shows case investigating existing open-source biosimulation model aciclovir.

title: User guide
text: package includes PIConfiguration class storing re-using settings parameter identification task. Currently, implemented options include: printIterationFeedback (logical) indicates objective function value printed iteration targetFunctionType (possible values: lsq, m3) indicates objective function used quantify difference observed data simulated curve. M3 method Beal, 2001 objective function accounts possible data points lower limit quantification. algorithm (possible values: bobyqa, Marq, Port, Newton, Nelder-Mead, BFGS, CG, L-BFGS-B, SANN, Pseudo) indicates optimization algorithms used. Control options can specified list passed piConfiguration$algorithmOptions.

title: User guide
text: sample PKML file model shipped package: parameter corresponding lipophilicity aciclovir called Aciclovir|Lipophilicity within model. parameter describing clearance called Neighborhoods|Kidney_pls_Kidney_ur|Aciclovir|Renal Clearances-TS|TSspec. can also look parameters model using package PIParameter class represent varying parameters model store along starting value, lower upper bounds parameter search space. default bounds 0.1 starting parameter value 10.0 starting parameter value, often useful supply parameter bounds previous knowledge:
code: simulations <- c(loadSimulation("tests/dev/Models/Simulations/Aciclovir.pkml")) names(simulations) <- "Aciclovir" getAllParametersMatching("**|TSspec", simulations$Aciclovir) #> [[1]] #> Parameter:  #>    Path: Neighborhoods|Kidney_pls_Kidney_ur|Aciclovir|Renal Clearances-TS|TSspec  #>    Value: 0.94 [1/min]  #>    isFormula: TRUE  #>    formula: TS / V_kid  #>    Value overrides formula: FALSE  #>    isStateVariable: FALSE parameters <- c(PIParameters$new(parameters = ospsuite::getParameter(     path = "Aciclovir|Lipophilicity",      container = simulations$Aciclovir   )), PIParameters$new(parameters = ospsuite::getParameter(     path = "Neighborhoods|Kidney_pls_Kidney_ur|Aciclovir|Renal Clearances-TS|TSspec",     container = simulations$Aciclovir   ))) parameters[[1]]$minValue <- -5 parameters[[1]]$maxValue <- 10 parameters[[2]]$minValue <- 0 parameters[[2]]$maxValue <- 10

title: User guide
text: need supply observed data going use identify parameter values. , importer configuration created createImporterConfigurationForFile helper function tries guess column names Excel file. run errors importing data, try create importer configuration PK-Sim GUI, export XML file re-use importing observed data R follows:
code: filePath <- "tests/data/AciclovirLaskinData.xlsx" dataConfiguration <- createImporterConfigurationForFile(filePath = filePath) dataConfiguration$sheets <- "Laskin 1982.Group A" dataConfiguration$namingPattern <- "{Source}.{Sheet}" observedData <- loadDataSetsFromExcel(xlsFilePath = filePath, importerConfigurationOrPath = dataConfiguration) filePath <- "tests/data/AciclovirLaskinData.xlsx" dataConfiguration <- loadDataImporterConfiguration("tests/data/dataImporter_configuration.xml") observedData <- loadDataSetsFromExcel(xlsFilePath = filePath, importerConfigurationOrPath = dataConfiguration)

title: User guide
text: Typically, observed data show concentration compound peripheral blood flow, can setups. class package matches model outputs observations called PIOutputMapping, example:
code: outputMapping <- PIOutputMapping$new(quantity = getQuantity("Organism|PeripheralVenousBlood|Aciclovir|Plasma (Peripheral Venous Blood)",   container = simulations$Aciclovir )) outputMapping$addObservedDataSets(observedData$`AciclovirLaskinData.Laskin 1982.Group A`) outputMapping$scaling <- "lin" outputMappings <- c(outputMapping)

title: User guide
text: outputMappings, simulations, parameters piConfiguration objects created, used instance ParameterIdentification class follows: piConfiguration$printIterationFeedback set TRUE, iteration print single line current objective function value, track performance optimization algorithm.
code: task <- ParameterIdentification$new(   simulations = simulations,   parameters = parameters,   outputMappings = outputMapping,   configuration = piConfiguration ) task_results <- task$run()

title: User guide
text: resulting object contains: task_results$par: vector point estimates parameters task_results$lwr task_results$upr: vectors lower bounds upper bounds 95% confidence interval parameters task_results$cv: vector coefficient variation (standard deviation point estimate, percents) parameters task object also contains $plotResults() function produces three diagnostic plots: individual time profile current best estimate model parameters overlayed observed data, comparison predicted-vs-observed values plot residuals vs time identify potential biases model. $plotResults() function can take optional vector parameter values plot curve corresponding another set model parameters.

title: Open Systems Pharmacology Parameter Identification package
text: OSPSuite.ParameterIdentification R-package provides functionality performing parameter identification (.e., fitting model observed data) simulations created Open Systems Pharmacology Software tools PK-Sim MoBi. package requires ospsuite package run simulations.

title: Get the steady-state values of species and state variable parameters. — getSteadyState
code: getSteadyState(   quantitiesPaths = NULL,   simulations,   steadyStateTime,   ignoreIfFormula = TRUE,   stopIfNotFound = TRUE,   lowerThreshold = 1e-15,   simulationRunOptions = NULL )

title: Get the steady-state values of species and state variable parameters. — getSteadyState
text: quantitiesPaths List quantity paths (molecules /parameters) steady-state simulated. NULL (default), molecules state variable parameters considered. list applied simulations. simulations Simulation object list Simulation objects steadyStateTime Simulation time (minutes). Must long enough system reach steady-state. 1000 default. Either single value (applied simulations), vector values specific simulation. latter case, must equal size simulations. ignoreIfFormula TRUE (default), species parameters initial values defined formula included. stopIfNotFound Boolean. TRUE (default), error thrown results certain species generated. may happen due numerical problems values calculated, though whole simulation converges. Setting argument FALSE allows ignore errors. Check outputs empty values using option. lowerThreshold Numerical value (default unit output). steady-state values value considered numerical noise replaced 0. lowerThreshold NULL, cut-applied. Default value 1e-15. simulationRunOptions Optional instance SimulationRunOptions used simulation run.

title: Get the steady-state values of species and state variable parameters. — getSteadyState
text: named list, names IDs simulations entries lists containing paths values end simulation.

title: Get the steady-state values of species and state variable parameters. — getSteadyState
text: steady-state considered last value simulation sufficiently long simulation time, .e., rates processes (significantly) change.

title: PIConfiguration — PIConfiguration
text: simulateSteadyState Boolean representing whether simulation brought steady-state first steadyStateTime Time minutes simulate simulating steady-state. May NULL printIterationFeedback Boolean. TRUE, output residuals calculation printed iteration. Default FALSE simulationRunOptions Object type SimulationRunOptions passed simulation runs. NULL, default options used. targetFunctionType Type target function used error calculation. Supported target functions  listed  ospsuite.parameteridentification::ObjectiveFunctions. algorithm string describing optimization algorithm, passed FME::modFit() function. Supported algorithms listed  ospsuite.parameteridentification::Algorithms. algorithmOptions list named parameters describing method-specific control arguments, passed FME::modFit() function. Supported options listed  ospsuite.parameteridentification::AlgorithmOptions.
